CVE-2017-0785.name: BlueBorne SDP Information Leak
CVE-2017-0785.description: The BlueBorne vulnerability in SDP servers allows an attacker to get information about memory layout.

CVE-2017-0781.name: BlueBorne RCE Vulnerability
CVE-2017-0781.description: The BlueBorne vulnerability allows remote code execution over the air.
affected_versions: All unpatched Linux devices with BlueZ

CVE-2018-5383.name: Bluetooth Pairing Key Validation
CVE-2018-5383.description: Vulnerability in Bluetooth Secure Simple Pairing and LE Secure Connections allows man-in-the-middle attacks.

CVE-2019-9506.name: KNOB Attack
CVE-2019-9506.description: Key Negotiation of Bluetooth (KNOB) attack allows forcing weaker encryption keys.

CVE-2019-2225.name: BlueFrag
CVE-2019-2225.description: A vulnerability in Bluetooth BNEP services allows remote code execution.
CVE-2019-2225.recommendation: Update to Android 10+ or apply security patches

CVE-2020-0022.name: BlueFrag 2
CVE-2020-0022.description: Heap overflow in Bluetooth implementation allows remote code execution.
CVE-2020-0022.recommendation: Update to Android 10+ or apply security patches

CVE-2020-10135.name: BIAS (Bluetooth Impersonation AttackS)
CVE-2020-10135.description: Allows an attacker to impersonate previously paired devices.

DEFAULT_PIN.name: Default PIN
DEFAULT_PIN.description: Device uses a default PIN code (like 0000, 1234) which is easily guessable.
affected_devices: All Bluetooth devices with PIN authentication

NO_SECURE_CONNECTIONS.name: No Secure Connections Support
NO_SECURE_CONNECTIONS.description: Device does not support Secure Connections mode introduced in Bluetooth 4.2.
NO_SECURE_CONNECTIONS.recommendation: Replace with device supporting Bluetooth 4.2+ with Secure Connections

PLAINTEXT_DATA.name: Plaintext Data Transmission
PLAINTEXT_DATA.description: Device transmits sensitive data without encryption.
PLAINTEXT_DATA.recommendation: Replace with device that implements encryption
affected_devices: Various IoT devices, especially older models

OVERFLOW_MAC_MODEL.name: MAC Address Model Overflow
OVERFLOW_MAC_MODEL.description: Buffer overflow in handling of model information during device discovery.
OVERFLOW_MAC_MODEL.recommendation: Keep device out of range of untrusted Bluetooth devices
affected_devices: Various smart locks including some LATCH models
